item.description:
Registration RSVP required please send an email to:ArcticBirds@EllisvilleMarsh.org

There are several Meetup RSVPs that do not match the official registration list. If you have not already done so, please email your contact information to reserve your seat. An RSVP on Meetup will not guarantee a seat at the talk.

This is a very popular talk and seats are filling quickly. Please include your name and contact information.

Where the birds go- Imagining summer in arctic Alaska Plimoth Plantation137 Warren Avenue, Plymouth, MA. Your RSVP on Meetup will not be added to the official register for the talk. Brad Winn of the Manomet Center for Conservation Sciences will present a talk "Where the birds go- Imagining summer in Arctic Alaska" on Sunday January 20th, from 4:00-6:00 pm at Plimoth Plantation.

Brad is a Conservation Specialist with the Shorebird Recovery Project at the Manomet Center for Conservation Sciences in Plymouth. Prior to joining the Manomet Center in early 2011, he spent 17 years in the Wildlife Resources Division of the Georgia Department of Natural Resources.Brad is a veteran crew member of research visits to the Arctic led each June by Dr. Stephen Brown, Manomet’s Director of Shorebird Science.

Last June, he and several others monitored and collected data on breeding shorebirds at the Canning River Delta in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in northern Alaska. The project is part of an ongoing, collaborative, Arctic-wide effort to understand the factors limiting shorebird populations. Brad will share highlights and display stunning photographs from the expedition. This event is open to the public and free of charge. Space is limited however:

Plimoth Plantation, the Friends of Ellisville Marsh, Friends of Myles Standish State Forest, and Sagamore Highlands Association are sponsoring the talk.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Where the birds go- Imagining summer in arctic Alaska
